title: Q&A with Blizzard leadership on return-to-office, bonuses leaves devs fuming

last_post.content:
Since the 2016 "QA Evolution", there was a consistent goal among #Blizzard #QA leadership: turning it into a career track.

The initial move was industry-standard titles (Assoc/Mid/Sen) and two additional career tracks, User Research and QA Engineering, both with the potential to reach salaries of $150k. They claimed there was no "entry level" in Blizz QA - 6mo exp was the minimum (that didn't hold).

My lead was adamant we grow from simply testing to quality *analysis*.

https://www.gamedeveloper.com/culture/q-a-with-blizzard-leadership-on-return-to-office-bonuses-leaves-devs-fuming

Stable Horde has grown so meteorically, in the past few months that I am in a state of constant firefighting around infrastructure woes, and can barely onboard new features. If I didn't have a few dedicated community members doing helping, I would just be focused on keeping it afloat.

Upheaval Dome, Utah

Upheaval Dome in Utah is 3.4 mile-diameter bull’s eye-shaped feature in Canyonlands National Park so large it can be seen from space. The rock layers in the center form an eroded dome (anticline) exposing the oldest rocks in the center, surrounded by down-sloping younger rocks (syncline).

There has been much debate over the formation of Upheaval Dome. It has come down to two major hypotheses: a. It was formed by a pinched-off salt diapir - the salt deposits deep below were more buoyant and bubbled up doming and intruding the overlying rock which has since been eroded down b. It was formed by the impact of a meteorite over 457 feet across as evidenced by shocked quartz grains. The Park website still includes both hypotheses although they reference this study as the most recent findings: https://pubs.geoscienceworld.org/gsa/geology/article-abstract/36/3/227/29673/Upheaval-Dome-Utah-USA-Impact-origin-confirmed They go on to say that many questions still remain. Anyone who has the latest findings, please weigh in here.

More on the geology here: https://geology.utah.gov/map-pub/survey-notes/geosights/upheaval-dome/

A beautiful aerial view of Upheaval Dome here: https://epod.usra.edu/blog/2013/04/upheaval-dome-in-canyonlands-national-park.html

Image from: https://earthobservatory.nasa.gov/images/7887/upheaval-dome-utah
